sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator uses 1000 J of energy to remove 800 J of heat from the interior and exhaust 200 J of heat to the atmosphere. Find the efficiency of the refrigerator.
message_2:
The efficiency of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the heat removed from the interior (Q_cold) to the work input (W). In this case, the refrigerator uses 1000 J of energy (work input) to remove 800 J of heat from the interior.

Efficiency = Q_cold / W

Efficiency = 800 J / 1000 J

Efficiency = 0.8 or 80%

The efficiency of the refrigerator is 80%.
